ygData.subject: Re: Population sizes
ygData.msgSnippet: I typically use around 150, but set the target species to 5 using a changing compatability threshold.  This gives a rough specie size of 30. I read somewhere,

I typically use around 150, but set the target species to 5 using a
changin=
g compatability threshold.  This gives a rough specie size of
30. I read so=
mewhere, and I can't remember where, some article about
Highland cattle hav=
ing to have a breeding population of 30 to make the
gene pool viable.

I gu=
ess its also a trade off with time also.  I am evolving Torcs
controllers f=
or Julain Togelius' CIG 2008 commpetition.  Each
controller takes around 4 =
seconds to evaluate.  If I had a pop of over
1000, it would take a long tim=
e for my poor laptop to finish each epoch.

Cheers

Matt

> Hello all-
> 
> What populat=
ion sizes to you typically use for NEAT?

he Avida digital evolution platform that
> suggest that below 1,000 org dri=
ft starts to play a role. But a lot
of the
> HyperNEAT papers use pop sizes=
 of 150 or so. My guess is that the
diversity
> preserving measure ('specia=
tion') and elitism help make smaller
populations
> effective, but I was won=
dering if anyone has looked at the effects of

an effort to provide a *rough but general*
> suggestion as to how big to ma=
ke the populations in NEAT.
